Articles.Content: I'd love to see data storage parts, imagine a couple of 5tb drives strapped to a research satellite. It would necessitate orbital relays for long term satellites. Strap a load of them together for your own Memory Alpha! I assume antennas have a range so storage stations along orbital relay systems would be awesome to design and set up, like a solar infrastructure. Anyway, think batteries, but for your precious science
i know right but use this in conjunction with the ability to upgrade spacecraft/satellites
I think Harvester confirmed earlier that some sort of data storage for pods and probes is going to be in the next update as part of the research and development system.

In the next update you'll need to store data and transmit it back to the space center. If there's going to be a limit about how much data you can store... well, I don't know, but if that happens, I think that data should be stored in "Kerbibits" (Just like in the SI system you have kibibits, tebibits...)
Since it is pretty certain this will appear in the next update, I think we can let this suggestion fall to the bottom.
